title: What is the explanation for the rapid amnesias observed in modern literature based on hypnosis and eye closure?
first_phrase: In this section of the book “Instantaneous Hypnosis and Fascination,” the author explains the phenomenon of rapid amnesia experienced during fascination-based hypnosis. The person's state of heightened vigilance created through fascination causes the sympathetic nervous system to release hormones and neurotransmitters. This state leads to tunnel vision, which reduces the person's visual field, often leading to spontaneous analgesia. The text goes on to explain how the person's shift into a relaxed parasympathetic state upon awakening can lead to amnesia. The section cites works from Lorenzo de’ Medici, William Atkinson, and Giordano Bruno, among others.
content: Questo può spiegare perchè così spesso quando eseguiamo l'ipnosi basata sulla fascinazione, creando quindi uno stato di concentrazione focalizzata questa sia seguita più facilmente da amnesia, vale a dire la memoria di quel che è successo sia molte volte assente.
